735  /**
736   * This is a convenience method that computes a new filename with a given file-number.
737   * @param filenum to use
738   */
739  protected Path computeFilename(final long filenum) {
740    if (filenum < 0) {
741      throw new RuntimeException("WAL file number can't be < 0");
742    }
743    String child = walFilePrefix + WAL_FILE_NAME_DELIMITER + filenum + walFileSuffix;
744    return new Path(walDir, child);
745  }
746
747  /**
748   * This is a convenience method that computes a new filename with a given using the current WAL
749   * file-number
750   */
751  public Path getCurrentFileName() {
752    return computeFilename(this.filenum.get());
753  }
754
755  /**
756   * retrieve the next path to use for writing. Increments the internal filenum.
757   */
758  private Path getNewPath() throws IOException {
759    this.filenum.set(Math.max(getFilenum() + 1, EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime()));
760    Path newPath = getCurrentFileName();
761    return newPath;
762  }
763
764  public Path getOldPath() {
765    long currentFilenum = this.filenum.get();
766    Path oldPath = null;
767    if (currentFilenum > 0) {
768      // ComputeFilename will take care of meta wal filename
769      oldPath = computeFilename(currentFilenum);
770    } // I presume if currentFilenum is <= 0, this is first file and null for oldPath if fine?
771    return oldPath;
772  }
773
774  /**
775   * Tell listeners about pre log roll.
776   */
777  private void tellListenersAboutPreLogRoll(final Path oldPath, final Path newPath)
778    throws IOException {
779    coprocessorHost.preWALRoll(oldPath, newPath);
780
781    if (!this.listeners.isEmpty()) {
782      for (WALActionsListener i : this.listeners) {
783        i.preLogRoll(oldPath, newPath);
784      }
785    }
786  }
787
788  /**
789   * Tell listeners about post log roll.
790   */
791  private void tellListenersAboutPostLogRoll(final Path oldPath, final Path newPath)
792    throws IOException {
793    if (!this.listeners.isEmpty()) {
794      for (WALActionsListener i : this.listeners) {
795        i.postLogRoll(oldPath, newPath);
796      }
797    }
798
799    coprocessorHost.postWALRoll(oldPath, newPath);
800  }
801
802  // public only until class moves to o.a.h.h.wal
803  /** Returns the number of rolled log files */
804  public int getNumRolledLogFiles() {
805    return walFile2Props.size();
806  }
807
808  // public only until class moves to o.a.h.h.wal
809  /** Returns the number of log files in use */
810  public int getNumLogFiles() {
811    // +1 for current use log
812    return getNumRolledLogFiles() + 1;
813  }
814
815  /**
816   * If the number of un-archived WAL files ('live' WALs) is greater than maximum allowed, check the
817   * first (oldest) WAL, and return those regions which should be flushed so that it can be
818   * let-go/'archived'.
819   * @return stores of regions (encodedRegionNames) to flush in order to archive the oldest WAL file
820   */
821  Map<byte[], List<byte[]>> findRegionsToForceFlush() throws IOException {
822    Map<byte[], List<byte[]>> regions = null;
823    int logCount = getNumRolledLogFiles();
824    if (logCount > this.maxLogs && logCount > 0) {
825      Map.Entry<Path, WALProps> firstWALEntry = this.walFile2Props.firstEntry();
826      regions =
827        this.sequenceIdAccounting.findLower(firstWALEntry.getValue().encodedName2HighestSequenceId);
828    }
829    if (regions != null) {
830      List<String> listForPrint = new ArrayList<>();
831      for (Map.Entry<byte[], List<byte[]>> r : regions.entrySet()) {
832        StringBuilder families = new StringBuilder();
833        for (int i = 0; i < r.getValue().size(); i++) {
834          if (i > 0) {
835            families.append(",");
836          }
837          families.append(Bytes.toString(r.getValue().get(i)));
838        }
839        listForPrint.add(Bytes.toStringBinary(r.getKey()) + "[" + families.toString() + "]");
840      }
841      LOG.info("Too many WALs; count=" + logCount + ", max=" + this.maxLogs
842        + "; forcing (partial) flush of " + regions.size() + " region(s): "
843        + StringUtils.join(",", listForPrint));
844    }
845    return regions;
846  }
847
848  /**
849   * Mark this WAL file as closed and call cleanOldLogs to see if we can archive this file.
850   */
851  private void markClosedAndClean(Path path) {
852    WALProps props = walFile2Props.get(path);
853    // typically this should not be null, but if there is no big issue if it is already null, so
854    // let's make the code more robust
855    if (props != null) {
856      props.closed = true;
857      cleanOldLogs();
858    }
859  }
860
861  /**
862   * Archive old logs. A WAL is eligible for archiving if all its WALEdits have been flushed.
863   * <p/>
864   * Use synchronized because we may call this method in different threads, normally when replacing
865   * writer, and since now close writer may be asynchronous, we will also call this method in the
866   * closeExecutor, right after we actually close a WAL writer.
867   */
868  private synchronized void cleanOldLogs() {
869    List<Pair<Path, Long>> logsToArchive = null;
870    long now = System.nanoTime();
871    boolean mayLogTooOld = nextLogTooOldNs <= now;
872    ArrayList<byte[]> regionsBlockingWal = null;
873    // For each log file, look at its Map of regions to the highest sequence id; if all sequence ids
874    // are older than what is currently in memory, the WAL can be GC'd.
875    for (Map.Entry<Path, WALProps> e : this.walFile2Props.entrySet()) {
876      if (!e.getValue().closed) {
877        LOG.debug("{} is not closed yet, will try archiving it next time", e.getKey());
878        continue;
879      }
880      Path log = e.getKey();
881      ArrayList<byte[]> regionsBlockingThisWal = null;
882      long ageNs = now - e.getValue().rollTimeNs;
883      if (ageNs > walTooOldNs) {
884        if (mayLogTooOld && regionsBlockingWal == null) {
885          regionsBlockingWal = new ArrayList<>();
886        }
887        regionsBlockingThisWal = regionsBlockingWal;
888      }
889      Map<byte[], Long> sequenceNums = e.getValue().encodedName2HighestSequenceId;
890      if (this.sequenceIdAccounting.areAllLower(sequenceNums, regionsBlockingThisWal)) {
891        if (logsToArchive == null) {
892          logsToArchive = new ArrayList<>();
893        }
894        logsToArchive.add(Pair.newPair(log, e.getValue().logSize));
895        if (LOG.isTraceEnabled()) {
896          LOG.trace("WAL file ready for archiving " + log);
897        }
898      } else if (regionsBlockingThisWal != null) {
899        StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder(log.toString()).append(" has not been archived for ")
900          .append(TimeUnit.NANOSECONDS.toSeconds(ageNs)).append(" seconds; blocked by: ");
901        boolean isFirst = true;
902        for (byte[] region : regionsBlockingThisWal) {
903          if (!isFirst) {
904            sb.append("; ");
905          }
906          isFirst = false;
907          sb.append(Bytes.toString(region));
908        }
909        LOG.warn(sb.toString());
910        nextLogTooOldNs = now + SURVIVED_TOO_LONG_LOG_INTERVAL_NS;
911        regionsBlockingThisWal.clear();
912      }
913    }
914
915    if (logsToArchive != null) {
916      final List<Pair<Path, Long>> localLogsToArchive = logsToArchive;
917      // make it async
918      for (Pair<Path, Long> log : localLogsToArchive) {
919        logArchiveExecutor.execute(() -> {
920          archive(log);
921        });
922        this.walFile2Props.remove(log.getFirst());
923      }
924    }
925  }
926
927  protected void archive(final Pair<Path, Long> log) {
928    totalLogSize.addAndGet(-log.getSecond());
929    int retry = 1;
930    while (true) {
931      try {
932        archiveLogFile(log.getFirst());
933        // successful
934        break;
935      } catch (Throwable e) {
936        if (retry > archiveRetries) {
937          LOG.error("Failed log archiving for the log {},", log.getFirst(), e);
938          if (this.abortable != null) {
939            this.abortable.abort("Failed log archiving", e);
940            break;
941          }
942        } else {
943          LOG.error("Log archiving failed for the log {} - attempt {}", log.getFirst(), retry, e);
944        }
945        retry++;
946      }
947    }
948  }
949
950  /*
951   * only public so WALSplitter can use.
952   * @return archived location of a WAL file with the given path p
953   */
954  public static Path getWALArchivePath(Path archiveDir, Path p) {
955    return new Path(archiveDir, p.getName());
956  }
957
958  protected void archiveLogFile(final Path p) throws IOException {
959    Path newPath = getWALArchivePath(this.walArchiveDir, p);
960    // Tell our listeners that a log is going to be archived.
961    if (!this.listeners.isEmpty()) {
962      for (WALActionsListener i : this.listeners) {
963        i.preLogArchive(p, newPath);
964      }
965    }
966    LOG.info("Archiving " + p + " to " + newPath);
967    if (!CommonFSUtils.renameAndSetModifyTime(this.fs, p, newPath)) {
968      throw new IOException("Unable to rename " + p + " to " + newPath);
969    }
970    // Tell our listeners that a log has been archived.
971    if (!this.listeners.isEmpty()) {
972      for (WALActionsListener i : this.listeners) {
973        i.postLogArchive(p, newPath);
974      }
975    }
976  }
977
978  protected final void logRollAndSetupWalProps(Path oldPath, Path newPath, long oldFileLen) {
979    int oldNumEntries = this.numEntries.getAndSet(0);
980    String newPathString = newPath != null ? CommonFSUtils.getPath(newPath) : null;
981    if (oldPath != null) {
982      this.walFile2Props.put(oldPath,
983        new WALProps(this.sequenceIdAccounting.resetHighest(), oldFileLen));
984      this.totalLogSize.addAndGet(oldFileLen);
985      LOG.info("Rolled WAL {} with entries={}, filesize={}; new WAL {}",
986        CommonFSUtils.getPath(oldPath), oldNumEntries, StringUtils.byteDesc(oldFileLen),
987        newPathString);
988    } else {
989      LOG.info("New WAL {}", newPathString);
990    }
991  }
992
993  private Span createSpan(String name) {
994    return TraceUtil.createSpan(name).setAttribute(WAL_IMPL, implClassName);
995  }
996
997  /**
998   * Cleans up current writer closing it and then puts in place the passed in {@code nextWriter}.
999   * <p/>
1000   * <ul>
1001   * <li>In the case of creating a new WAL, oldPath will be null.</li>
1002   * <li>In the case of rolling over from one file to the next, none of the parameters will be null.
1003   * </li>
1004   * <li>In the case of closing out this FSHLog with no further use newPath and nextWriter will be
1005   * null.</li>
1006   * </ul>
1007   * @param oldPath    may be null
1008   * @param newPath    may be null
1009   * @param nextWriter may be null
1010   * @return the passed in <code>newPath</code>
1011   * @throws IOException if there is a problem flushing or closing the underlying FS
1012   */
1013  Path replaceWriter(Path oldPath, Path newPath, W nextWriter) throws IOException {
1014    return TraceUtil.trace(() -> {
1015      doReplaceWriter(oldPath, newPath, nextWriter);
1016      return newPath;
1017    }, () -> createSpan("WAL.replaceWriter"));
1018  }
1019
1020  protected final void blockOnSync(SyncFuture syncFuture) throws IOException {
1021    // Now we have published the ringbuffer, halt the current thread until we get an answer back.
1022    try {
1023      if (syncFuture != null) {
1024        if (closed) {
1025          throw new IOException("WAL has been closed");
1026        } else {
1027          syncFuture.get(walSyncTimeoutNs);
1028        }
1029      }
1030    } catch (TimeoutIOException tioe) {
1031      throw new WALSyncTimeoutIOException(tioe);
1032    } catch (InterruptedException ie) {
1033      LOG.warn("Interrupted", ie);
1034      throw convertInterruptedExceptionToIOException(ie);
1035    } catch (ExecutionException e) {
1036      throw ensureIOException(e.getCause());
1037    }
1038  }
1039
1040  private static IOException ensureIOException(final Throwable t) {
1041    return (t instanceof IOException) ? (IOException) t : new IOException(t);
1042  }
1043
1044  private IOException convertInterruptedExceptionToIOException(final InterruptedException ie) {
1045    Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
1046    IOException ioe = new InterruptedIOException();
1047    ioe.initCause(ie);
1048    return ioe;
1049  }
1050
1051  private W createCombinedWriter(W localWriter, Path localPath)
1052    throws IOException, CommonFSUtils.StreamLacksCapabilityException {
1053    // retry forever if we can not create the remote writer to prevent aborting the RS due to log
1054    // rolling error, unless the skipRemoteWal is set to true.
1055    // TODO: since for now we only have one thread doing log rolling, this may block the rolling for
1056    // other wals
1057    Path remoteWAL = new Path(remoteWALDir, localPath.getName());
1058    for (int retry = 0;; retry++) {
1059      if (skipRemoteWAL) {
1060        return localWriter;
1061      }
1062      W remoteWriter;
1063      try {
1064        remoteWriter = createWriterInstance(remoteFs, remoteWAL);
1065      } catch (IOException e) {
1066        LOG.warn("create remote writer {} failed, retry = {}", remoteWAL, retry, e);
1067        try {
1068          Thread.sleep(ConnectionUtils.getPauseTime(100, retry));
1069        } catch (InterruptedException ie) {
1070          // restore the interrupt state
1071          Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
1072          // must close local writer here otherwise no one will close it for us
1073          Closeables.close(localWriter, true);
1074          throw (IOException) new InterruptedIOException().initCause(ie);
1075        }
1076        continue;
1077      }
1078      return createCombinedWriter(localWriter, remoteWriter);
1079    }
1080  }
1081
1082  private Map<byte[], List<byte[]>> rollWriterInternal(boolean force) throws IOException {
1083    rollWriterLock.lock();
1084    try {
1085      if (this.closed) {
1086        throw new WALClosedException("WAL has been closed");
1087      }
1088      // Return if nothing to flush.
1089      if (!force && this.writer != null && this.numEntries.get() <= 0) {
1090        return null;
1091      }
1092      Map<byte[], List<byte[]>> regionsToFlush = null;
1093      try {
1094        Path oldPath = getOldPath();
1095        Path newPath = getNewPath();
1096        // Any exception from here on is catastrophic, non-recoverable, so we currently abort.
1097        W nextWriter = this.createWriterInstance(fs, newPath);
1098        if (remoteFs != null) {
1099          // create a remote wal if necessary
1100          nextWriter = createCombinedWriter(nextWriter, newPath);
1101        }
1102        tellListenersAboutPreLogRoll(oldPath, newPath);
1103        // NewPath could be equal to oldPath if replaceWriter fails.
1104        newPath = replaceWriter(oldPath, newPath, nextWriter);
1105        tellListenersAboutPostLogRoll(oldPath, newPath);
1106        if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
1107          LOG.debug("Create new " + implClassName + " writer with pipeline: "
1108            + Arrays.toString(getPipeline()));
1109        }
1110        // We got a new writer, so reset the slow sync count
1111        lastTimeCheckSlowSync = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime();
1112        slowSyncCount.set(0);
1113        // Can we delete any of the old log files?
1114        if (getNumRolledLogFiles() > 0) {
1115          cleanOldLogs();
1116          regionsToFlush = findRegionsToForceFlush();
1117        }
1118      } catch (CommonFSUtils.StreamLacksCapabilityException exception) {
1119        // If the underlying FileSystem can't do what we ask, treat as IO failure, so
1120        // we'll abort.
1121        throw new IOException(
1122          "Underlying FileSystem can't meet stream requirements. See RS log " + "for details.",
1123          exception);
1124      }
1125      return regionsToFlush;
1126    } finally {
1127      rollWriterLock.unlock();
1128    }
1129  }
1130
1131  @Override
1132  public Map<byte[], List<byte[]>> rollWriter(boolean force) throws IOException {
1133    return TraceUtil.trace(() -> rollWriterInternal(force), () -> createSpan("WAL.rollWriter"));
1134  }
1135
1136  // public only until class moves to o.a.h.h.wal
1137  /** Returns the size of log files in use */
1138  public long getLogFileSize() {
1139    return this.totalLogSize.get();
1140  }
1141
1142  // public only until class moves to o.a.h.h.wal
1143  public void requestLogRoll() {
1144    requestLogRoll(ERROR);
1145  }
1146
1147  /**
1148   * Get the backing files associated with this WAL.
1149   * @return may be null if there are no files.
1150   */
1151  FileStatus[] getFiles() throws IOException {
1152    return CommonFSUtils.listStatus(fs, walDir, ourFiles);
1153  }
1154
1155  @Override
1156  public void shutdown() throws IOException {
1157    if (!shutdown.compareAndSet(false, true)) {
1158      return;
1159    }
1160    closed = true;
1161    // Tell our listeners that the log is closing
1162    if (!this.listeners.isEmpty()) {
1163      for (WALActionsListener i : this.listeners) {
1164        i.logCloseRequested();
1165      }
1166    }
1167
1168    ExecutorService shutdownExecutor = Executors.newSingleThreadExecutor(
1169      new ThreadFactoryBuilder().setDaemon(true).setNameFormat("WAL-Shutdown-%d").build());
1170
1171    Future<Void> future = shutdownExecutor.submit(new Callable<Void>() {
1172      @Override
1173      public Void call() throws Exception {
1174        if (rollWriterLock.tryLock(walShutdownTimeout, TimeUnit.SECONDS)) {
1175          try {
1176            doShutdown();
1177            if (syncFutureCache != null) {
1178              syncFutureCache.clear();
1179            }
1180          } finally {
1181            rollWriterLock.unlock();
1182          }
1183        } else {
1184          throw new IOException("Waiting for rollWriterLock timeout");
1185        }
1186        return null;
1187      }
1188    });
1189    shutdownExecutor.shutdown();
1190
1191    try {
1192      future.get(walShutdownTimeout, TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS);
1193    } catch (InterruptedException e) {
1194      throw new InterruptedIOException("Interrupted when waiting for shutdown WAL");
1195    } catch (TimeoutException e) {
1196      throw new TimeoutIOException("We have waited " + walShutdownTimeout + "ms, but"
1197        + " the shutdown of WAL doesn't complete! Please check the status of underlying "
1198        + "filesystem or increase the wait time by the config \"" + WAL_SHUTDOWN_WAIT_TIMEOUT_MS
1199        + "\"", e);
1200    } catch (ExecutionException e) {
1201      if (e.getCause() instanceof IOException) {
1202        throw (IOException) e.getCause();
1203      } else {
1204        throw new IOException(e.getCause());
1205      }
1206    } finally {
1207      // in shutdown, we may call cleanOldLogs so shutdown this executor in the end.
1208      // In sync replication implementation, we may shut down a WAL without shutting down the whole
1209      // region server, if we shut down this executor earlier we may get reject execution exception
1210      // and abort the region server
1211      logArchiveExecutor.shutdown();
1212    }
1213    // we also need to wait logArchive to finish if we want to a graceful shutdown as we may still
1214    // have some pending archiving tasks not finished yet, and in close we may archive all the
1215    // remaining WAL files, there could be race if we do not wait for the background archive task
1216    // finish
1217    try {
1218      if (!logArchiveExecutor.awaitTermination(walShutdownTimeout, TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS)) {
1219        throw new TimeoutIOException("We have waited " + walShutdownTimeout + "ms, but"
1220          + " the shutdown of WAL doesn't complete! Please check the status of underlying "
1221          + "filesystem or increase the wait time by the config \"" + WAL_SHUTDOWN_WAIT_TIMEOUT_MS
1222          + "\"");
1223      }
1224    } catch (InterruptedException e) {
1225      throw new InterruptedIOException("Interrupted when waiting for shutdown WAL");
1226    }
1227  }
1228
1229  @Override
1230  public void close() throws IOException {
1231    shutdown();
1232    final FileStatus[] files = getFiles();
1233    if (null != files && 0 != files.length) {
1234      for (FileStatus file : files) {
1235        Path p = getWALArchivePath(this.walArchiveDir, file.getPath());
1236        // Tell our listeners that a log is going to be archived.
1237        if (!this.listeners.isEmpty()) {
1238          for (WALActionsListener i : this.listeners) {
1239            i.preLogArchive(file.getPath(), p);
1240          }
1241        }
1242
1243        if (!CommonFSUtils.renameAndSetModifyTime(fs, file.getPath(), p)) {
1244          throw new IOException("Unable to rename " + file.getPath() + " to " + p);
1245        }
1246        // Tell our listeners that a log was archived.
1247        if (!this.listeners.isEmpty()) {
1248          for (WALActionsListener i : this.listeners) {
1249            i.postLogArchive(file.getPath(), p);
1250          }
1251        }
1252      }
1253      LOG.debug(
1254        "Moved " + files.length + " WAL file(s) to " + CommonFSUtils.getPath(this.walArchiveDir));
1255    }
1256    LOG.info("Closed WAL: " + toString());
1257  }
1258
1259  /** Returns number of WALs currently in the process of closing. */
1260  public int getInflightWALCloseCount() {
1261    return inflightWALClosures.size();
1262  }
1263
1264  /**
1265   * updates the sequence number of a specific store. depending on the flag: replaces current seq
1266   * number if the given seq id is bigger, or even if it is lower than existing one
1267   */
1268  @Override
1269  public void updateStore(byte[] encodedRegionName, byte[] familyName, Long sequenceid,
1270    boolean onlyIfGreater) {
1271    sequenceIdAccounting.updateStore(encodedRegionName, familyName, sequenceid, onlyIfGreater);
1272  }
1273
1274  protected final SyncFuture getSyncFuture(long sequence, boolean forceSync) {
1275    return syncFutureCache.getIfPresentOrNew().reset(sequence, forceSync);
1276  }
1277
1278  protected boolean isLogRollRequested() {
1279    return rollRequested.get();
1280  }
1281
1282  protected final void requestLogRoll(final WALActionsListener.RollRequestReason reason) {
1283    // If we have already requested a roll, don't do it again
1284    // And only set rollRequested to true when there is a registered listener
1285    if (!this.listeners.isEmpty() && rollRequested.compareAndSet(false, true)) {
1286      for (WALActionsListener i : this.listeners) {
1287        i.logRollRequested(reason);
1288      }
1289    }
1290  }
1291
1292  long getUnflushedEntriesCount() {
1293    long highestSynced = this.highestSyncedTxid.get();
1294    long highestUnsynced = this.highestUnsyncedTxid;
1295    return highestSynced >= highestUnsynced ? 0 : highestUnsynced - highestSynced;
1296  }
1297
1298  boolean isUnflushedEntries() {
1299    return getUnflushedEntriesCount() > 0;
1300  }
1301
1302  /**
1303   * Exposed for testing only. Use to tricks like halt the ring buffer appending.
1304   */
1305  protected void atHeadOfRingBufferEventHandlerAppend() {
1306    // Noop
1307  }
1308
1309  protected final boolean appendEntry(W writer, FSWALEntry entry) throws IOException {
1310    // TODO: WORK ON MAKING THIS APPEND FASTER. DOING WAY TOO MUCH WORK WITH CPs, PBing, etc.
1311    atHeadOfRingBufferEventHandlerAppend();
1312    long start = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime();
1313    byte[] encodedRegionName = entry.getKey().getEncodedRegionName();
1314    long regionSequenceId = entry.getKey().getSequenceId();
1315
1316    // Edits are empty, there is nothing to append. Maybe empty when we are looking for a
1317    // region sequence id only, a region edit/sequence id that is not associated with an actual
1318    // edit. It has to go through all the rigmarole to be sure we have the right ordering.
1319    if (entry.getEdit().isEmpty()) {
1320      return false;
1321    }
1322
1323    // Coprocessor hook.
1324    coprocessorHost.preWALWrite(entry.getRegionInfo(), entry.getKey(), entry.getEdit());
1325    if (!listeners.isEmpty()) {
1326      for (WALActionsListener i : listeners) {
1327        i.visitLogEntryBeforeWrite(entry.getRegionInfo(), entry.getKey(), entry.getEdit());
1328      }
1329    }
1330    doAppend(writer, entry);
1331    assert highestUnsyncedTxid < entry.getTxid();
1332    highestUnsyncedTxid = entry.getTxid();
1333    if (entry.isCloseRegion()) {
1334      // let's clean all the records of this region
1335      sequenceIdAccounting.onRegionClose(encodedRegionName);
1336    } else {
1337      sequenceIdAccounting.update(encodedRegionName, entry.getFamilyNames(), regionSequenceId,
1338        entry.isInMemStore());
1339    }
1340    coprocessorHost.postWALWrite(entry.getRegionInfo(), entry.getKey(), entry.getEdit());
1341    // Update metrics.
1342    postAppend(entry, EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime() - start);
1343    numEntries.incrementAndGet();
1344    return true;
1345  }
1346
1347  private long postAppend(final Entry e, final long elapsedTime) throws IOException {
1348    long len = 0;
1349    if (!listeners.isEmpty()) {
1350      for (Cell cell : e.getEdit().getCells()) {
1351        len += PrivateCellUtil.estimatedSerializedSizeOf(cell);
1352      }
1353      for (WALActionsListener listener : listeners) {
1354        listener.postAppend(len, elapsedTime, e.getKey(), e.getEdit());
1355      }
1356    }
1357    return len;
1358  }
1359
1360  protected final void postSync(long timeInNanos, int handlerSyncs) {
1361    if (timeInNanos > this.slowSyncNs) {
1362      String msg = new StringBuilder().append("Slow sync cost: ")
1363        .append(TimeUnit.NANOSECONDS.toMillis(timeInNanos)).append(" ms, current pipeline: ")
1364        .append(Arrays.toString(getPipeline())).toString();
1365      LOG.info(msg);
1366      if (timeInNanos > this.rollOnSyncNs) {
1367        // A single sync took too long.
1368        // Elsewhere in checkSlowSync, called from checkLogRoll, we will look at cumulative
1369        // effects. Here we have a single data point that indicates we should take immediate
1370        // action, so do so.
1371        LOG.warn("Requesting log roll because we exceeded slow sync threshold; time="
1372          + TimeUnit.NANOSECONDS.toMillis(timeInNanos) + " ms, threshold="
1373          + TimeUnit.NANOSECONDS.toMillis(rollOnSyncNs) + " ms, current pipeline: "
1374          + Arrays.toString(getPipeline()));
1375        requestLogRoll(SLOW_SYNC);
1376      }
1377      slowSyncCount.incrementAndGet(); // it's fine to unconditionally increment this
1378    }
1379    if (!listeners.isEmpty()) {
1380      for (WALActionsListener listener : listeners) {
1381        listener.postSync(timeInNanos, handlerSyncs);
1382      }
1383    }
1384  }
1385
1386  protected final long stampSequenceIdAndPublishToRingBuffer(RegionInfo hri, WALKeyImpl key,
1387    WALEdit edits, boolean inMemstore, RingBuffer<RingBufferTruck> ringBuffer) throws IOException {
1388    if (this.closed) {
1389      throw new IOException(
1390        "Cannot append; log is closed, regionName = " + hri.getRegionNameAsString());
1391    }
1392    MutableLong txidHolder = new MutableLong();
1393    MultiVersionConcurrencyControl.WriteEntry we = key.getMvcc().begin(() -> {
1394      txidHolder.setValue(ringBuffer.next());
1395    });
1396    long txid = txidHolder.longValue();
1397    ServerCall<?> rpcCall = RpcServer.getCurrentServerCallWithCellScanner().orElse(null);
1398    try {
1399      FSWALEntry entry = new FSWALEntry(txid, key, edits, hri, inMemstore, rpcCall);
1400      entry.stampRegionSequenceId(we);
1401      ringBuffer.get(txid).load(entry);
1402    } finally {
1403      ringBuffer.publish(txid);
1404    }
1405    return txid;
1406  }
1407
1408  @Override
1409  public String toString() {
1410    return implClassName + " " + walFilePrefix + ":" + walFileSuffix + "(num " + filenum + ")";
1411  }
1412
1413  /**
1414   * if the given {@code path} is being written currently, then return its length.
1415   * <p>
1416   * This is used by replication to prevent replicating unacked log entries. See
1417   * https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HBASE-14004 for more details.
1418   */
1419  @Override
1420  public OptionalLong getLogFileSizeIfBeingWritten(Path path) {
1421    rollWriterLock.lock();
1422    try {
1423      Path currentPath = getOldPath();
1424      if (path.equals(currentPath)) {
1425        // Currently active path.
1426        W writer = this.writer;
1427        return writer != null ? OptionalLong.of(writer.getSyncedLength()) : OptionalLong.empty();
1428      } else {
1429        W temp = inflightWALClosures.get(path.getName());
1430        if (temp != null) {
1431          // In the process of being closed, trailer bytes may or may not be flushed.
1432          // Ensuring that we read all the bytes in a file is critical for correctness of tailing
1433          // use cases like replication, see HBASE-25924/HBASE-25932.
1434          return OptionalLong.of(temp.getSyncedLength());
1435        }
1436        // Log rolled successfully.
1437        return OptionalLong.empty();
1438      }
1439    } finally {
1440      rollWriterLock.unlock();
1441    }
1442  }
1443
1444  @Override
1445  public long appendData(RegionInfo info, WALKeyImpl key, WALEdit edits) throws IOException {
1446    return TraceUtil.trace(() -> append(info, key, edits, true),
1447      () -> createSpan("WAL.appendData"));
1448  }
1449
1450  @Override
1451  public long appendMarker(RegionInfo info, WALKeyImpl key, WALEdit edits) throws IOException {
1452    return TraceUtil.trace(() -> append(info, key, edits, false),
1453      () -> createSpan("WAL.appendMarker"));
1454  }
1455
1456  /**
1457   * Helper that marks the future as DONE and offers it back to the cache.
1458   */
1459  protected void markFutureDoneAndOffer(SyncFuture future, long txid, Throwable t) {
1460    future.done(txid, t);
1461    syncFutureCache.offer(future);
1462  }
1463
1464  private static boolean waitingRoll(int epochAndState) {
1465    return (epochAndState & 1) != 0;
1466  }
1467
1468  private static boolean writerBroken(int epochAndState) {
1469    return ((epochAndState >>> 1) & 1) != 0;
1470  }
1471
1472  private static int epoch(int epochAndState) {
1473    return epochAndState >>> 2;
1474  }
1475
1476  // return whether we have successfully set readyForRolling to true.
1477  private boolean trySetReadyForRolling() {
1478    // Check without holding lock first. Usually we will just return here.
1479    // waitingRoll is volatile and unacedEntries is only accessed inside event loop, so it is safe
1480    // to check them outside the consumeLock.
1481    if (!waitingRoll(epochAndState) || !unackedAppends.isEmpty()) {
1482      return false;
1483    }
1484    consumeLock.lock();
1485    try {
1486      // 1. a roll is requested
1487      // 2. all out-going entries have been acked(we have confirmed above).
1488      if (waitingRoll(epochAndState)) {
1489        readyForRolling = true;
1490        readyForRollingCond.signalAll();
1491        return true;
1492      } else {
1493        return false;
1494      }
1495    } finally {
1496      consumeLock.unlock();
1497    }
1498  }
1499
1500  private void syncFailed(long epochWhenSync, Throwable error) {
1501    LOG.warn("sync failed", error);
1502    this.onException(epochWhenSync, error);
1503  }
1504
1505  private void onException(long epochWhenSync, Throwable error) {
1506    boolean shouldRequestLogRoll = true;
1507    consumeLock.lock();
1508    try {
1509      int currentEpochAndState = epochAndState;
1510      if (epoch(currentEpochAndState) != epochWhenSync || writerBroken(currentEpochAndState)) {
1511        // this is not the previous writer which means we have already rolled the writer.
1512        // or this is still the current writer, but we have already marked it as broken and request
1513        // a roll.
1514        return;
1515      }
1516      this.epochAndState = currentEpochAndState | 0b10;
1517      if (waitingRoll(currentEpochAndState)) {
1518        readyForRolling = true;
1519        readyForRollingCond.signalAll();
1520        // this means we have already in the middle of a rollWriter so just tell the roller thread
1521        // that you can continue without requesting an extra log roll.
1522        shouldRequestLogRoll = false;
1523      }
1524    } finally {
1525      consumeLock.unlock();
1526    }
1527    for (Iterator<FSWALEntry> iter = unackedAppends.descendingIterator(); iter.hasNext();) {
1528      toWriteAppends.addFirst(iter.next());
1529    }
1530    highestUnsyncedTxid = highestSyncedTxid.get();
1531    if (shouldRequestLogRoll) {
1532      // request a roll.
1533      requestLogRoll(ERROR);
1534    }
1535  }
1536
1537  private void syncCompleted(long epochWhenSync, W writer, long processedTxid, long startTimeNs) {
1538    // Please see the last several comments on HBASE-22761, it is possible that we get a
1539    // syncCompleted which acks a previous sync request after we received a syncFailed on the same
1540    // writer. So here we will also check on the epoch and state, if the epoch has already been
1541    // changed, i.e, we have already rolled the writer, or the writer is already broken, we should
1542    // just skip here, to avoid mess up the state or accidentally release some WAL entries and
1543    // cause data corruption.
1544    // The syncCompleted call is on the critical write path, so we should try our best to make it
1545    // fast. So here we do not hold consumeLock, for increasing performance. It is safe because
1546    // there are only 3 possible situations:
1547    // 1. For normal case, the only place where we change epochAndState is when rolling the writer.
1548    // Before rolling actually happen, we will only change the state to waitingRoll which is another
1549    // bit than writerBroken, and when we actually change the epoch, we can make sure that there is
1550    // no outgoing sync request. So we will always pass the check here and there is no problem.
1551    // 2. The writer is broken, but we have not called syncFailed yet. In this case, since
1552    // syncFailed and syncCompleted are executed in the same thread, we will just face the same
1553    // situation with #1.
1554    // 3. The writer is broken, and syncFailed has been called. Then when we arrive here, there are
1555    // only 2 possible situations:
1556    // a. we arrive before we actually roll the writer, then we will find out the writer is broken
1557    // and give up.
1558    // b. we arrive after we actually roll the writer, then we will find out the epoch is changed
1559    // and give up.
1560    // For both #a and #b, we do not need to hold the consumeLock as we will always update the
1561    // epochAndState as a whole.
1562    // So in general, for all the cases above, we do not need to hold the consumeLock.
1563    int epochAndState = this.epochAndState;
1564    if (epoch(epochAndState) != epochWhenSync || writerBroken(epochAndState)) {
1565      LOG.warn("Got a sync complete call after the writer is broken, skip");
1566      return;
1567    }
1568
1569    if (processedTxid < highestSyncedTxid.get()) {
1570      return;
1571    }
1572    highestSyncedTxid.set(processedTxid);
1573    for (Iterator<FSWALEntry> iter = unackedAppends.iterator(); iter.hasNext();) {
1574      FSWALEntry entry = iter.next();
1575      if (entry.getTxid() <= processedTxid) {
1576        entry.release();
1577        iter.remove();
1578      } else {
1579        break;
1580      }
1581    }
1582    postSync(System.nanoTime() - startTimeNs, finishSync());
1583    /**
1584     * This method is used to be compatible with the original logic of {@link FSHLog}.
1585     */
1586    checkSlowSyncCount();
1587    if (trySetReadyForRolling()) {
1588      // we have just finished a roll, then do not need to check for log rolling, the writer will be
1589      // closed soon.
1590      return;
1591    }
1592    // If we haven't already requested a roll, check if we have exceeded logrollsize
1593    if (!isLogRollRequested() && writer.getLength() > logrollsize) {
1594      if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
1595        LOG.debug("Requesting log roll because of file size threshold; length=" + writer.getLength()
1596          + ", logrollsize=" + logrollsize);
1597      }
1598      requestLogRoll(SIZE);
1599    }
1600  }
1601
1602  // find all the sync futures between these two txids to see if we need to issue a hsync, if no
1603  // sync futures then just use the default one.
1604  private boolean isHsync(long beginTxid, long endTxid) {
1605    SortedSet<SyncFuture> futures = syncFutures.subSet(new SyncFuture().reset(beginTxid, false),
1606      new SyncFuture().reset(endTxid + 1, false));
1607    if (futures.isEmpty()) {
1608      return useHsync;
1609    }
1610    for (SyncFuture future : futures) {
1611      if (future.isForceSync()) {
1612        return true;
1613      }
1614    }
1615    return false;
1616  }
1617
1618  private void sync(W writer) {
1619    fileLengthAtLastSync = writer.getLength();
1620    long currentHighestProcessedAppendTxid = highestProcessedAppendTxid;
1621    boolean shouldUseHsync =
1622      isHsync(highestProcessedAppendTxidAtLastSync, currentHighestProcessedAppendTxid);
1623    highestProcessedAppendTxidAtLastSync = currentHighestProcessedAppendTxid;
1624    final long startTimeNs = System.nanoTime();
1625    final long epoch = (long) epochAndState >>> 2L;
1626    addListener(doWriterSync(writer, shouldUseHsync, currentHighestProcessedAppendTxid),
1627      (result, error) -> {
1628        if (error != null) {
1629          syncFailed(epoch, error);
1630        } else {
1631          long syncedTxid = getSyncedTxid(currentHighestProcessedAppendTxid, result);
1632          syncCompleted(epoch, writer, syncedTxid, startTimeNs);
1633        }
1634      }, consumeExecutor);
1635  }
1636
1637  /**
1638   * This method is to adapt {@link FSHLog} and {@link AsyncFSWAL}. For {@link AsyncFSWAL}, we use
1639   * {@link AbstractFSWAL#highestProcessedAppendTxid} at the point we calling
1640   * {@link AsyncFSWAL#doWriterSync} method as successful syncedTxid. For {@link FSHLog}, because we
1641   * use multi-thread {@code SyncRunner}s, we used the result of {@link CompletableFuture} as
1642   * successful syncedTxid.
1643   */
1644  protected long getSyncedTxid(long processedTxid, long completableFutureResult) {
1645    return processedTxid;
1646  }
1647
1648  protected abstract CompletableFuture<Long> doWriterSync(W writer, boolean shouldUseHsync,
1649    long txidWhenSyn);
1650
1651  private int finishSyncLowerThanTxid(long txid) {
1652    int finished = 0;
1653    for (Iterator<SyncFuture> iter = syncFutures.iterator(); iter.hasNext();) {
1654      SyncFuture sync = iter.next();
1655      if (sync.getTxid() <= txid) {
1656        markFutureDoneAndOffer(sync, txid, null);
1657        iter.remove();
1658        finished++;
1659      } else {
1660        break;
1661      }
1662    }
1663    return finished;
1664  }
1665
1666  // try advancing the highestSyncedTxid as much as possible
1667  private int finishSync() {
1668    if (unackedAppends.isEmpty()) {
1669      // All outstanding appends have been acked.
1670      if (toWriteAppends.isEmpty()) {
1671        // Also no appends that wait to be written out, then just finished all pending syncs.
1672        long maxSyncTxid = highestSyncedTxid.get();
1673        for (SyncFuture sync : syncFutures) {
1674          maxSyncTxid = Math.max(maxSyncTxid, sync.getTxid());
1675          markFutureDoneAndOffer(sync, maxSyncTxid, null);
1676        }
1677        highestSyncedTxid.set(maxSyncTxid);
1678        int finished = syncFutures.size();
1679        syncFutures.clear();
1680        return finished;
1681      } else {
1682        // There is no append between highestProcessedAppendTxid and lowestUnprocessedAppendTxid, so
1683        // if highestSyncedTxid >= highestProcessedAppendTxid, then all syncs whose txid are between
1684        // highestProcessedAppendTxid and lowestUnprocessedAppendTxid can be finished.
1685        long lowestUnprocessedAppendTxid = toWriteAppends.peek().getTxid();
1686        assert lowestUnprocessedAppendTxid > highestProcessedAppendTxid;
1687        long doneTxid = lowestUnprocessedAppendTxid - 1;
1688        highestSyncedTxid.set(doneTxid);
1689        return finishSyncLowerThanTxid(doneTxid);
1690      }
1691    } else {
1692      // There are still unacked appends. So let's move the highestSyncedTxid to the txid of the
1693      // first unacked append minus 1.
1694      long lowestUnackedAppendTxid = unackedAppends.peek().getTxid();
1695      long doneTxid = Math.max(lowestUnackedAppendTxid - 1, highestSyncedTxid.get());
1696      highestSyncedTxid.set(doneTxid);
1697      return finishSyncLowerThanTxid(doneTxid);
1698    }
1699  }
1700
1701  // confirm non-empty before calling
1702  private static long getLastTxid(Deque<FSWALEntry> queue) {
1703    return queue.peekLast().getTxid();
1704  }
1705
1706  private void appendAndSync() throws IOException {
1707    final W writer = this.writer;
1708    // maybe a sync request is not queued when we issue a sync, so check here to see if we could
1709    // finish some.
1710    finishSync();
1711    long newHighestProcessedAppendTxid = -1L;
1712    // this is used to avoid calling peedLast every time on unackedAppends, appendAndAsync is single
1713    // threaded, this could save us some cycles
1714    boolean addedToUnackedAppends = false;
1715    for (Iterator<FSWALEntry> iter = toWriteAppends.iterator(); iter.hasNext();) {
1716      FSWALEntry entry = iter.next();
1717      /**
1718       * For {@link FSHog},here may throw IOException,but for {@link AsyncFSWAL}, here would not
1719       * throw any IOException.
1720       */
1721      boolean appended = appendEntry(writer, entry);
1722      newHighestProcessedAppendTxid = entry.getTxid();
1723      iter.remove();
1724      if (appended) {
1725        // This is possible, when we fail to sync, we will add the unackedAppends back to
1726        // toWriteAppends, so here we may get an entry which is already in the unackedAppends.
1727        if (
1728          addedToUnackedAppends || unackedAppends.isEmpty()
1729            || getLastTxid(unackedAppends) < entry.getTxid()
1730        ) {
1731          unackedAppends.addLast(entry);
1732          addedToUnackedAppends = true;
1733        }
1734        // See HBASE-25905, here we need to make sure that, we will always write all the entries in
1735        // unackedAppends out. As the code in the consume method will assume that, the entries in
1736        // unackedAppends have all been sent out so if there is roll request and unackedAppends is
1737        // not empty, we could just return as later there will be a syncCompleted call to clear the
1738        // unackedAppends, or a syncFailed to lead us to another state.
1739        // There could be other ways to fix, such as changing the logic in the consume method, but
1740        // it will break the assumption and then (may) lead to a big refactoring. So here let's use
1741        // this way to fix first, can optimize later.
1742        if (
1743          writer.getLength() - fileLengthAtLastSync >= batchSize
1744            && (addedToUnackedAppends || entry.getTxid() >= getLastTxid(unackedAppends))
1745        ) {
1746          break;
1747        }
1748      }
1749    }
1750    // if we have a newer transaction id, update it.
1751    // otherwise, use the previous transaction id.
1752    if (newHighestProcessedAppendTxid > 0) {
1753      highestProcessedAppendTxid = newHighestProcessedAppendTxid;
1754    } else {
1755      newHighestProcessedAppendTxid = highestProcessedAppendTxid;
1756    }
1757
1758    if (writer.getLength() - fileLengthAtLastSync >= batchSize) {
1759      // sync because buffer size limit.
1760      sync(writer);
1761      return;
1762    }
1763    if (writer.getLength() == fileLengthAtLastSync) {
1764      // we haven't written anything out, just advance the highestSyncedSequence since we may only
1765      // stamp some region sequence id.
1766      if (unackedAppends.isEmpty()) {
1767        highestSyncedTxid.set(highestProcessedAppendTxid);
1768        finishSync();
1769        trySetReadyForRolling();
1770      }
1771      return;
1772    }
1773    // reach here means that we have some unsynced data but haven't reached the batch size yet,
1774    // but we will not issue a sync directly here even if there are sync requests because we may
1775    // have some new data in the ringbuffer, so let's just return here and delay the decision of
1776    // whether to issue a sync in the caller method.
1777  }
1778
1779  private void consume() {
1780    consumeLock.lock();
1781    try {
1782      int currentEpochAndState = epochAndState;
1783      if (writerBroken(currentEpochAndState)) {
1784        return;
1785      }
1786      if (waitingRoll(currentEpochAndState)) {
1787        if (writer.getLength() > fileLengthAtLastSync) {
1788          // issue a sync
1789          sync(writer);
1790        } else {
1791          if (unackedAppends.isEmpty()) {
1792            readyForRolling = true;
1793            readyForRollingCond.signalAll();
1794          }
1795        }
1796        return;
1797      }
1798    } finally {
1799      consumeLock.unlock();
1800    }
1801    long nextCursor = waitingConsumePayloadsGatingSequence.get() + 1;
1802    for (long cursorBound = waitingConsumePayloads.getCursor(); nextCursor
1803        <= cursorBound; nextCursor++) {
1804      if (!waitingConsumePayloads.isPublished(nextCursor)) {
1805        break;
1806      }
1807      RingBufferTruck truck = waitingConsumePayloads.get(nextCursor);
1808      switch (truck.type()) {
1809        case APPEND:
1810          toWriteAppends.addLast(truck.unloadAppend());
1811          break;
1812        case SYNC:
1813          syncFutures.add(truck.unloadSync());
1814          break;
1815        default:
1816          LOG.warn("RingBufferTruck with unexpected type: " + truck.type());
1817          break;
1818      }
1819      waitingConsumePayloadsGatingSequence.set(nextCursor);
1820    }
1821
1822    /**
1823     * This method is used to be compatible with the original logic of {@link AsyncFSWAL}.
1824     */
1825    if (markerEditOnly) {
1826      drainNonMarkerEditsAndFailSyncs();
1827    }
1828    try {
1829      appendAndSync();
1830    } catch (IOException exception) {
1831      /**
1832       * For {@link FSHog},here may catch IOException,but for {@link AsyncFSWAL}, the code doesn't
1833       * go in here.
1834       */
1835      LOG.error("appendAndSync throws IOException.", exception);
1836      onAppendEntryFailed(exception);
1837      return;
1838    }
1839    if (hasConsumerTask.get()) {
1840      return;
1841    }
1842    if (toWriteAppends.isEmpty()) {
1843      if (waitingConsumePayloadsGatingSequence.get() == waitingConsumePayloads.getCursor()) {
1844        consumerScheduled.set(false);
1845        // recheck here since in append and sync we do not hold the consumeLock. Thing may
1846        // happen like
1847        // 1. we check cursor, no new entry
1848        // 2. someone publishes a new entry to ringbuffer and the consumerScheduled is true and
1849        // give up scheduling the consumer task.
1850        // 3. we set consumerScheduled to false and also give up scheduling consumer task.
1851        if (waitingConsumePayloadsGatingSequence.get() == waitingConsumePayloads.getCursor()) {
1852          // we will give up consuming so if there are some unsynced data we need to issue a sync.
1853          if (
1854            writer.getLength() > fileLengthAtLastSync && !syncFutures.isEmpty()
1855              && syncFutures.last().getTxid() > highestProcessedAppendTxidAtLastSync
1856          ) {
1857            // no new data in the ringbuffer and we have at least one sync request
1858            sync(writer);
1859          }
1860          return;
1861        } else {
1862          // maybe someone has grabbed this before us
1863          if (!consumerScheduled.compareAndSet(false, true)) {
1864            return;
1865          }
1866        }
1867      }
1868    }
1869    // reschedule if we still have something to write.
1870    consumeExecutor.execute(consumer);
1871  }
1872
1873  private boolean shouldScheduleConsumer() {
1874    int currentEpochAndState = epochAndState;
1875    if (writerBroken(currentEpochAndState) || waitingRoll(currentEpochAndState)) {
1876      return false;
1877    }
1878    return consumerScheduled.compareAndSet(false, true);
1879  }
1880
1881  /**
1882   * Append a set of edits to the WAL.
1883   * <p/>
1884   * The WAL is not flushed/sync'd after this transaction completes BUT on return this edit must
1885   * have its region edit/sequence id assigned else it messes up our unification of mvcc and
1886   * sequenceid. On return <code>key</code> will have the region edit/sequence id filled in.
1887   * <p/>
1888   * NOTE: This appends, at a time that is usually after this call returns, starts a mvcc
1889   * transaction by calling 'begin' wherein which we assign this update a sequenceid. At assignment
1890   * time, we stamp all the passed in Cells inside WALEdit with their sequenceId. You must
1891   * 'complete' the transaction this mvcc transaction by calling
1892   * MultiVersionConcurrencyControl#complete(...) or a variant otherwise mvcc will get stuck. Do it
1893   * in the finally of a try/finally block within which this appends lives and any subsequent
1894   * operations like sync or update of memstore, etc. Get the WriteEntry to pass mvcc out of the
1895   * passed in WALKey <code>walKey</code> parameter. Be warned that the WriteEntry is not
1896   * immediately available on return from this method. It WILL be available subsequent to a sync of
1897   * this append; otherwise, you will just have to wait on the WriteEntry to get filled in.
1898   * @param hri        the regioninfo associated with append
1899   * @param key        Modified by this call; we add to it this edits region edit/sequence id.
1900   * @param edits      Edits to append. MAY CONTAIN NO EDITS for case where we want to get an edit
1901   *                   sequence id that is after all currently appended edits.
1902   * @param inMemstore Always true except for case where we are writing a region event meta marker
1903   *                   edit, for example, a compaction completion record into the WAL or noting a
1904   *                   Region Open event. In these cases the entry is just so we can finish an
1905   *                   unfinished compaction after a crash when the new Server reads the WAL on
1906   *                   recovery, etc. These transition event 'Markers' do not go via the memstore.
1907   *                   When memstore is false, we presume a Marker event edit.
1908   * @return Returns a 'transaction id' and <code>key</code> will have the region edit/sequence id
1909   *         in it.
1910   */
1911  protected long append(RegionInfo hri, WALKeyImpl key, WALEdit edits, boolean inMemstore)
1912    throws IOException {
1913    if (markerEditOnly && !edits.isMetaEdit()) {
1914      throw new IOException("WAL is closing, only marker edit is allowed");
1915    }
1916    long txid =
1917      stampSequenceIdAndPublishToRingBuffer(hri, key, edits, inMemstore, waitingConsumePayloads);
1918    if (shouldScheduleConsumer()) {
1919      consumeExecutor.execute(consumer);
1920    }
1921    return txid;
1922  }
1923
1924  protected void doSync(boolean forceSync) throws IOException {
1925    long txid = waitingConsumePayloads.next();
1926    SyncFuture future;
1927    try {
1928      future = getSyncFuture(txid, forceSync);
1929      RingBufferTruck truck = waitingConsumePayloads.get(txid);
1930      truck.load(future);
1931    } finally {
1932      waitingConsumePayloads.publish(txid);
1933    }
1934    if (shouldScheduleConsumer()) {
1935      consumeExecutor.execute(consumer);
1936    }
1937    blockOnSync(future);
1938  }
1939
1940  protected void doSync(long txid, boolean forceSync) throws IOException {
1941    if (highestSyncedTxid.get() >= txid) {
1942      return;
1943    }
1944    // here we do not use ring buffer sequence as txid
1945    long sequence = waitingConsumePayloads.next();
1946    SyncFuture future;
1947    try {
1948      future = getSyncFuture(txid, forceSync);
1949      RingBufferTruck truck = waitingConsumePayloads.get(sequence);
1950      truck.load(future);
1951    } finally {
1952      waitingConsumePayloads.publish(sequence);
1953    }
1954    if (shouldScheduleConsumer()) {
1955      consumeExecutor.execute(consumer);
1956    }
1957    blockOnSync(future);
1958  }
1959
1960  private void drainNonMarkerEditsAndFailSyncs() {
1961    if (toWriteAppends.isEmpty()) {
1962      return;
1963    }
1964    boolean hasNonMarkerEdits = false;
1965    Iterator<FSWALEntry> iter = toWriteAppends.descendingIterator();
1966    while (iter.hasNext()) {
1967      FSWALEntry entry = iter.next();
1968      if (!entry.getEdit().isMetaEdit()) {
1969        entry.release();
1970        hasNonMarkerEdits = true;
1971        break;
1972      }
1973    }
1974    if (hasNonMarkerEdits) {
1975      for (;;) {
1976        iter.remove();
1977        if (!iter.hasNext()) {
1978          break;
1979        }
1980        iter.next().release();
1981      }
1982      for (FSWALEntry entry : unackedAppends) {
1983        entry.release();
1984      }
1985      unackedAppends.clear();
1986      // fail the sync futures which are under the txid of the first remaining edit, if none, fail
1987      // all the sync futures.
1988      long txid = toWriteAppends.isEmpty() ? Long.MAX_VALUE : toWriteAppends.peek().getTxid();
1989      IOException error = new IOException("WAL is closing, only marker edit is allowed");
1990      for (Iterator<SyncFuture> syncIter = syncFutures.iterator(); syncIter.hasNext();) {
1991        SyncFuture future = syncIter.next();
1992        if (future.getTxid() < txid) {
1993          markFutureDoneAndOffer(future, future.getTxid(), error);
1994          syncIter.remove();
1995        } else {
1996          break;
1997        }
1998      }
1999    }
2000  }
2001
2002  protected abstract W createWriterInstance(FileSystem fs, Path path)
2003    throws IOException, CommonFSUtils.StreamLacksCapabilityException;
2004
2005  protected abstract W createCombinedWriter(W localWriter, W remoteWriter);
2006
2007  protected final void waitForSafePoint() {
2008    consumeLock.lock();
2009    try {
2010      int currentEpochAndState = epochAndState;
2011      if (writerBroken(currentEpochAndState) || this.writer == null) {
2012        return;
2013      }
2014      consumerScheduled.set(true);
2015      epochAndState = currentEpochAndState | 1;
2016      readyForRolling = false;
2017      consumeExecutor.execute(consumer);
2018      while (!readyForRolling) {
2019        readyForRollingCond.awaitUninterruptibly();
2020      }
2021    } finally {
2022      consumeLock.unlock();
2023    }
2024  }
2025
2026  private void recoverLease(FileSystem fs, Path p, Configuration conf) {
2027    try {
2028      RecoverLeaseFSUtils.recoverFileLease(fs, p, conf, null);
2029    } catch (IOException ex) {
2030      LOG.error("Unable to recover lease after several attempts. Give up.", ex);
2031    }
2032  }
2033
2034  protected final void closeWriter(W writer, Path path) {
2035    inflightWALClosures.put(path.getName(), writer);
2036    closeExecutor.execute(() -> {
2037      try {
2038        writer.close();
2039      } catch (IOException e) {
2040        LOG.warn("close old writer failed.", e);
2041        recoverLease(this.fs, path, conf);
2042      } finally {
2043        // call this even if the above close fails, as there is no other chance we can set closed to
2044        // true, it will not cause big problems.
2045        markClosedAndClean(path);
2046        inflightWALClosures.remove(path.getName());
2047      }
2048    });
2049  }
2050
2051  /**
2052   * Notice that you need to clear the {@link #rollRequested} flag in this method, as the new writer
2053   * will begin to work before returning from this method. If we clear the flag after returning from
2054   * this call, we may miss a roll request. The implementation class should choose a proper place to
2055   * clear the {@link #rollRequested} flag, so we do not miss a roll request, typically before you
2056   * start writing to the new writer.
2057   */
2058  protected void doReplaceWriter(Path oldPath, Path newPath, W nextWriter) throws IOException {
2059    Preconditions.checkNotNull(nextWriter);
2060    waitForSafePoint();
2061    /**
2062     * For {@link FSHLog},here would shut down {@link FSHLog.SyncRunner}.
2063     */
2064    doCleanUpResources();
2065    // we will call rollWriter in init method, where we want to create the first writer and
2066    // obviously the previous writer is null, so here we need this null check. And why we must call
2067    // logRollAndSetupWalProps before closeWriter is that, we will call markClosedAndClean after
2068    // closing the writer asynchronously, we need to make sure the WALProps is put into
2069    // walFile2Props before we call markClosedAndClean
2070    if (writer != null) {
2071      long oldFileLen = writer.getLength();
2072      logRollAndSetupWalProps(oldPath, newPath, oldFileLen);
2073      closeWriter(writer, oldPath);
2074    } else {
2075      logRollAndSetupWalProps(oldPath, newPath, 0);
2076    }
2077    this.writer = nextWriter;
2078    /**
2079     * Here is used for {@link AsyncFSWAL} and {@link FSHLog} to set the under layer filesystem
2080     * output after writer is replaced.
2081     */
2082    onWriterReplaced(nextWriter);
2083    this.fileLengthAtLastSync = nextWriter.getLength();
2084    this.highestProcessedAppendTxidAtLastSync = 0L;
2085    consumeLock.lock();
2086    try {
2087      consumerScheduled.set(true);
2088      int currentEpoch = epochAndState >>> 2;
2089      int nextEpoch = currentEpoch == MAX_EPOCH ? 0 : currentEpoch + 1;
2090      // set a new epoch and also clear waitingRoll and writerBroken
2091      this.epochAndState = nextEpoch << 2;
2092      // Reset rollRequested status
2093      rollRequested.set(false);
2094      consumeExecutor.execute(consumer);
2095    } finally {
2096      consumeLock.unlock();
2097    }
2098  }
2099
2100  protected abstract void onWriterReplaced(W nextWriter);
2101
2102  protected void doShutdown() throws IOException {
2103    waitForSafePoint();
2104    /**
2105     * For {@link FSHLog},here would shut down {@link FSHLog.SyncRunner}.
2106     */
2107    doCleanUpResources();
2108    if (this.writer != null) {
2109      closeWriter(this.writer, getOldPath());
2110      this.writer = null;
2111    }
2112    closeExecutor.shutdown();
2113    try {
2114      if (!closeExecutor.awaitTermination(waitOnShutdownInSeconds, TimeUnit.SECONDS)) {
2115        LOG.error("We have waited " + waitOnShutdownInSeconds + " seconds but"
2116          + " the close of async writer doesn't complete."
2117          + "Please check the status of underlying filesystem"
2118          + " or increase the wait time by the config \"" + this.waitOnShutdownInSecondsConfigKey
2119          + "\"");
2120      }
2121    } catch (InterruptedException e) {
2122      LOG.error("The wait for close of async writer is interrupted");
2123      Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
2124    }
2125    IOException error = new IOException("WAL has been closed");
2126    long nextCursor = waitingConsumePayloadsGatingSequence.get() + 1;
2127    // drain all the pending sync requests
2128    for (long cursorBound = waitingConsumePayloads.getCursor(); nextCursor
2129        <= cursorBound; nextCursor++) {
2130      if (!waitingConsumePayloads.isPublished(nextCursor)) {
2131        break;
2132      }
2133      RingBufferTruck truck = waitingConsumePayloads.get(nextCursor);
2134      switch (truck.type()) {
2135        case SYNC:
2136          syncFutures.add(truck.unloadSync());
2137          break;
2138        default:
2139          break;
2140      }
2141    }
2142    // and fail them
2143    syncFutures.forEach(f -> markFutureDoneAndOffer(f, f.getTxid(), error));
2144    if (this.shouldShutDownConsumeExecutorWhenClose) {
2145      consumeExecutor.shutdown();
2146    }
2147  }
2148
2149  protected void doCleanUpResources() {
2150  };
2151
2152  protected abstract void doAppend(W writer, FSWALEntry entry) throws IOException;
2153
2154  /**
2155   * This method gets the pipeline for the current WAL.
2156   */
2157  abstract DatanodeInfo[] getPipeline();
2158
2159  /**
2160   * This method gets the datanode replication count for the current WAL.
2161   */
2162  abstract int getLogReplication();
2163
2164  protected abstract boolean doCheckLogLowReplication();
2165
2166  protected boolean isWriterBroken() {
2167    return writerBroken(epochAndState);
2168  }
2169
2170  private void onAppendEntryFailed(IOException exception) {
2171    LOG.warn("append entry failed", exception);
2172    final long currentEpoch = (long) epochAndState >>> 2L;
2173    this.onException(currentEpoch, exception);
2174  }
2175
2176  protected void checkSlowSyncCount() {
2177  }
2178
2179  /** Returns true if we exceeded the slow sync roll threshold over the last check interval */
2180  protected boolean doCheckSlowSync() {
2181    boolean result = false;
2182    long now = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime();
2183    long elapsedTime = now - lastTimeCheckSlowSync;
2184    if (elapsedTime >= slowSyncCheckInterval) {
2185      if (slowSyncCount.get() >= slowSyncRollThreshold) {
2186        if (elapsedTime >= (2 * slowSyncCheckInterval)) {
2187          // If two or more slowSyncCheckInterval have elapsed this is a corner case
2188          // where a train of slow syncs almost triggered us but then there was a long
2189          // interval from then until the one more that pushed us over. If so, we
2190          // should do nothing and let the count reset.
2191          if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
2192            LOG.debug("checkSlowSync triggered but we decided to ignore it; " + "count="
2193              + slowSyncCount.get() + ", threshold=" + slowSyncRollThreshold + ", elapsedTime="
2194              + elapsedTime + " ms, slowSyncCheckInterval=" + slowSyncCheckInterval + " ms");
2195          }
2196          // Fall through to count reset below
2197        } else {
2198          LOG.warn("Requesting log roll because we exceeded slow sync threshold; count="
2199            + slowSyncCount.get() + ", threshold=" + slowSyncRollThreshold + ", current pipeline: "
2200            + Arrays.toString(getPipeline()));
2201          result = true;
2202        }
2203      }
2204      lastTimeCheckSlowSync = now;
2205      slowSyncCount.set(0);
2206    }
2207    return result;
2208  }
2209
2210  public void checkLogLowReplication(long checkInterval) {
2211    long now = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime();
2212    if (now - lastTimeCheckLowReplication < checkInterval) {
2213      return;
2214    }
2215    // Will return immediately if we are in the middle of a WAL log roll currently.
2216    if (!rollWriterLock.tryLock()) {
2217      return;
2218    }
2219    try {
2220      lastTimeCheckLowReplication = now;
2221      if (doCheckLogLowReplication()) {
2222        requestLogRoll(LOW_REPLICATION);
2223      }
2224    } finally {
2225      rollWriterLock.unlock();
2226    }
2227  }
2228
2229  // Allow temporarily skipping the creation of remote writer. When failing to write to the remote
2230  // dfs cluster, we need to reopen the regions and switch to use the original wal writer. But we
2231  // need to write a close marker when closing a region, and if it fails, the whole rs will abort.
2232  // So here we need to skip the creation of remote writer and make it possible to write the region
2233  // close marker.
2234  // Setting markerEdit only to true is for transiting from A to S, where we need to give up writing
2235  // any pending wal entries as they will be discarded. The remote cluster will replicate the
2236  // correct data back later. We still need to allow writing marker edits such as close region event
2237  // to allow closing a region.
2238  @Override
2239  public void skipRemoteWAL(boolean markerEditOnly) {
2240    if (markerEditOnly) {
2241      this.markerEditOnly = true;
2242    }
2243    this.skipRemoteWAL = true;
2244  }
2245
2246  private static void split(final Configuration conf, final Path p) throws IOException {
2247    FileSystem fs = CommonFSUtils.getWALFileSystem(conf);
2248    if (!fs.exists(p)) {
2249      throw new FileNotFoundException(p.toString());
2250    }
2251    if (!fs.getFileStatus(p).isDirectory()) {
2252      throw new IOException(p + " is not a directory");
2253    }
2254
2255    final Path baseDir = CommonFSUtils.getWALRootDir(conf);
2256    Path archiveDir = new Path(baseDir, HConstants.HREGION_OLDLOGDIR_NAME);
2257    if (
2258      conf.getBoolean(AbstractFSWALProvider.SEPARATE_OLDLOGDIR,
2259        AbstractFSWALProvider.DEFAULT_SEPARATE_OLDLOGDIR)
2260    ) {
2261      archiveDir = new Path(archiveDir, p.getName());
2262    }
2263    WALSplitter.split(baseDir, p, archiveDir, fs, conf, WALFactory.getInstance(conf));
2264  }
2265
2266  W getWriter() {
2267    return this.writer;
2268  }
2269
2270  private static void usage() {
2271    System.err.println("Usage: AbstractFSWAL <ARGS>");
2272    System.err.println("Arguments:");
2273    System.err.println(" --dump  Dump textual representation of passed one or more files");
2274    System.err.println("         For example: "
2275      + "AbstractFSWAL --dump hdfs://example.com:9000/hbase/WALs/MACHINE/LOGFILE");
2276    System.err.println(" --split Split the passed directory of WAL logs");
2277    System.err.println(
2278      "         For example: AbstractFSWAL --split hdfs://example.com:9000/hbase/WALs/DIR");
2279  }
2280
2281  /**
2282   * Pass one or more log file names, and it will either dump out a text version on
2283   * <code>stdout</code> or split the specified log files.
2284   */
2285  public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
2286    if (args.length < 2) {
2287      usage();
2288      System.exit(-1);
2289    }
2290    // either dump using the WALPrettyPrinter or split, depending on args
2291    if (args[0].compareTo("--dump") == 0) {
2292      WALPrettyPrinter.run(Arrays.copyOfRange(args, 1, args.length));
2293    } else if (args[0].compareTo("--perf") == 0) {
2294      LOG.error(HBaseMarkers.FATAL, "Please use the WALPerformanceEvaluation tool instead. i.e.:");
2295      LOG.error(HBaseMarkers.FATAL,
2296        "\thbase org.apache.hadoop.hbase.wal.WALPerformanceEvaluation --iterations " + args[1]);
2297      System.exit(-1);
2298    } else if (args[0].compareTo("--split") == 0) {
2299      Configuration conf = HBaseConfiguration.create();
2300      for (int i = 1; i < args.length; i++) {
2301        try {
2302          Path logPath = new Path(args[i]);
2303          CommonFSUtils.setFsDefault(conf, logPath);
2304          split(conf, logPath);
2305        } catch (IOException t) {
2306          t.printStackTrace(System.err);
2307          System.exit(-1);
2308        }
2309      }
2310    } else {
2311      usage();
2312      System.exit(-1);
2313    }
2314  }
2315}
